function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate bathroom infrastructure in residential buildings for preventing virus transmission between occupants during quarantine.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to increased transmission of viruses","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate distancing measures leading to higher risk of virus transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral transmission in buildings and transportation","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Environmental contamination in hospitals","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in building activities and layouts due to covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus transmission in crowded and poorly ventilated rooms","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate building design for preventing virus spread","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative impact on economic progress","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Development and sharing of data models for infectious diseases","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of machine-readable epidemiological quantitative data","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate sharing of epidemiological quantitative data","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of the entity-quality eq model or the adaptation of the resources, events, agents rea model for ontology evaluation may introduce semantic and logical complexities.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The rise of new variants of the virus that may challenge vaccine efficacy","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of compatible logical model for representing and sharing machine-readable patient monitoring and epidemiology surveillance data","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Unclear taxonomy structure for infectious diseases ontology","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reuse of ontological terms and models from existing sources","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of owl 2, a dl-based formalism and semantic web standard for knowledge representation","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Building a fair resource for health data and research","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excluded areas may have different socioeconomic variables, potentially biasing the results.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of individual-level socioeconomic data limited detailed study of mechanisms at work.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Decrease in testing rate in the most deprived areas signals a deterioration in access to preventive measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between social inequalities and differential exposure to the virus, susceptibility to infection, comorbidities, and access to care.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differential sars-cov-2 incidence, positivity rates, and testing rates in socially deprived areas compared to the least deprived areas.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low return rate of people who completely gave up public transport","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Congestion in public transport during rush hours","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased use of public transport due to fear of contagion","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift to private vehicles and shared mobility services","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation between feeling of safety and feeling of comfort with willingness to use public transport after the epidemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding in public transport due to miscalculation","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited or resigned use of public transport","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear of infection with covid-19 leading to a shift from public transport to private vehicles.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Factors affecting comfort and safety in public transport during the pandemic, including fear of other passengers not following hygienic measures and tidiness of the vehicle.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Switch from stationary work and learning to e-learning and online work","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear of coronavirus infection leading to limited mobility and social lives","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Passengers declare a majority of factors as important for their comfort in public transport, indicating a potential risk of transmission of contagious diseases from other passengers.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Passengers identify other passengers as a key factor in feeling safe in public transport, suggesting a risk of contagious disease transmission from other passengers.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Existence of cctv systems is deemed least important for feeling safe in public transport, potentially indicating a risk of inadequate surveillance for safety and hygiene practices.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High frequency of public transport usage","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low percentage of public transport users for environmental reasons","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Digital technologies for tracking mobility pose privacy and ethical challenges","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of public transport during pandemic may lead to increased risk of contagious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conversion of car lanes into bike lanes and sidewalks may impact mobility behaviors","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pre- and post-pandemic mobility behavior analysis may lead to ineffective solutions if not updated with the latest data and trends","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk-taking attitudes affecting human mobility and social confinement may lead to increased disease spread","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on smartphone user data for epidemic tracking may pose privacy and data security risks","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced walking and mobility among women due to pandemic restrictions","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased commuting and increased isolation for high-density populations and older subpopulations","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of private cars due to safety concerns about public transport","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dramatic reduction in demand for public transport","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
